task.title: Fix cloud channel communication for human users

events.content: Added subscribe_channels message to usePresence hook: Added subscribe_channels message to usePresence hook

raw.question: Added subscribe_channels message to usePresence hook
raw.chosen: Added subscribe_channels message to usePresence hook
raw.reasoning: Frontend was using usePresence for WebSocket connection but never sent subscribe_channels message, so setupDaemonChannelProxy was never triggered and channel messages weren't forwarded to cloud users

events.content: Normalized channel IDs to include # prefix in API responses: Normalized channel IDs to include # prefix in API responses

raw.question: Normalized channel IDs to include # prefix in API responses
raw.chosen: Normalized channel IDs to include # prefix in API responses
raw.reasoning: Channel IDs had format mismatch: API stored 'foobar' but daemon used '#foobar'. This caused duplicate channels in UI and messages not appearing until re-selecting channel because selectedChannelId didn't match event.channel

events.content: Added channelClientsByWorkspace tracking for channel event broadcasting: Added channelClientsByWorkspace tracking for channel event broadcasting

raw.question: Added channelClientsByWorkspace tracking for channel event broadcasting
raw.chosen: Added channelClientsByWorkspace tracking for channel event broadcasting
raw.reasoning: When new channels are created, all connected clients in the workspace need to be notified via WebSocket broadcast so the channel appears in their UI without page refresh

events.content: Used workspace.publicUrl for daemon channel proxy connection: Used workspace.publicUrl for daemon channel proxy connection

raw.question: Used workspace.publicUrl for daemon channel proxy connection
raw.chosen: Used workspace.publicUrl for daemon channel proxy connection
raw.reasoning: The daemon and userBridge run on the workspace server, not the cloud server. Must connect to workspace.publicUrl to reach the correct daemon instance where agents are spawned

retrospective.summary: Fixed cloud channel communication: 1) Added subscribe_channels to usePresence hook to trigger daemon channel proxy, 2) Normalized channel IDs with # prefix for consistency between API and daemon, 3) Added workspace client tracking for channel_created broadcasts. Messages now flow to all cloud users in real-time without duplicate channels or manual refresh.
